intro: Cyphostemma termetophilum, commonly known as the desert milkvine, is a climbing plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Cyphostemma termetophilum is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
